title: Wifi calling intermittent failures
content:
This is happening on multiple Pixel 5 units on T-Mobile.
It does not happen with a Pixel 2 or 3 on the same network  (location) & also t-mobile.
The issue manifests when wifi calling is enabled (either mobile  or wifi preferred). Note that if I set mobile preferred the phone chooses wifi almost always (even though mobile is working fine if I disable wifi).
wifi calling works perfectly if I enable airplane mode and then enable wifi.
After doing #4 wifi calling works for a day or so once airplane mode is disabled. Service then reverts.
Issue when it occurs is that audio stops in one direction only (varies between tx and rx). It *seems* that one direction is flipping to mobile and the other is remaining on wifi. I have no equipment to test that hypothesis. 
This issue has occurred since I purchased the phone. I have previously reached out to google support; then t-mobile support; now back to you.
